    • Constructor Detail

      • HitBox

        public HitBox(String name,
              javafx.geometry.BoundingBox bounds)
        Creates a hit box with given name and bounds. The bounds are calculated from the local entity origin in local coordinates.

        For example: an entity with width 40 and height 80 could have 2 hit boxes. one for HEAD and one for BODY as follows: 

             Entity entity = ...
     entity.addHitBox(new HitBox("HEAD", new BoundingBox(0, 0, 40, 40));
     entity.addHitBox(new HitBox("BODY", new BoundingBox(0, 40, 40, 40));
        Note, the 2nd bounding box has y = 40.
        Parameters:
        name - hit box name
        bounds - hit box bounds

    • Method Detail

                                        double y)
        Computes new bounds based on translated X and Y of an entity.
        Parameters:

        y - entity y

                                                double y,
                                                double entityWidth)

        Parameters:

        entityWidth - entity width
